messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 08/12/1999 11:43:22 PM Eastern Daylight Time, LisaBugg@unschooling.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 08/12/1999 11:43:22 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
LisaBugg@... writes:

<< It's nice to know that phonics confuses someone
else. My mil thinks I must be wrong when I say that phonics makes no sense
to my now 9 year old. :) I also have a 7. 5 year old who has no interest in
reading either. Now, taking things apart, that he can do for hours and
hours, not to mention playing video games.
>>
Lisa, we must have the same mil (they just dress differently!) :-)
she contstantly tries to "teach" my 7.5 yo dd. Neither of my girls are
phonetic readers--they could practice phonics on worksheets until they (and
I) were blue in the face, but when they would try to read they'd say "Huh?"
So we just read a lot because we love it.
Here's an unschooling "moment". The other night We were all sitting in and
reading our various books. Hannah (the 7.5 yo) was also "reading" but this
time she started to read one of the "Little Bear' books out loud to herself.
It was cool. She has always told me that she is too busy playing to learn
to read!! All things in their own time!!
Debra
